content:
You raise a valid point. Despite the Academy's efforts to promote diversity and inclusion, it's worth noting that Hollywood has a long history of marginalization and discrimination against people of color, women, LGBTQ+ individuals, and other underrepresented communities. The industry's systemic issues will not be solved overnight, and it will take sustained effort and commitment from all parties involved to bring about meaningful change.

It's also worth acknowledging that the Academy itself has faced criticism for its lack of diversity and inclusivity in the past. While the Academy's recent initiatives are a step in the right direction, it will be important to hold them accountable and ensure they follow through on their commitments.

At the end of the day, it will take a collective effort from all stakeholders in the industry to bring about meaningful change. This includes not just the Academy, but also production companies, studios, talent agencies, and individual filmmakers and actors. It will involve creating a culture of accountability and respect, providing more opportunities for underrepresented communities, and challenging the industry's historical norms and biases.
